member.name: T:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods to DateTime, TimeSpan and other methods related to these types

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions.Absolute(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Returns the absolute timespan that corresponds to the given one
member.param: The original timespan
member.returns: If the given time span is positive, the method returns the same value; otherwise it returns the opposite (i.e. positive) time span that has the same absolute value as the given one

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions.MinutesAsMilliseconds(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the number of milliseconds in the specified number of minutes
member.param: The number of minutes to convert to milliseconds
member.returns: The result of the calculation

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions.SecondsAsMilliseconds(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the number of milliseconds in the specified number of seconds
member.param: The number of seconds to convert to milliseconds
member.returns: The result of the calculation

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions.Milliseconds(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a TimeSpan that represents the given number of milliseconds
member.param: The number of milliseconds
member.returns: The TimeSpan struct that represent the given number of milliseconds

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions.Seconds(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a TimeSpan that represents the given number of seconds
member.param: The number of seconds
member.returns: The TimeSpan struct that represent the given number of seconds

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions.Minutes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a TimeSpan that represents the given number of minutes
member.param: The number of minutes
member.returns: The TimeSpan struct that represent the given number of minutes

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions.Hours(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a TimeSpan that represents the given number of hours
member.param: The number of hours
member.returns: The TimeSpan struct that represent the given number of hours

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions.MutliplyBy(System.TimeSpan,System.Double)
member.summary: Multiplies the specified TimeSpan by the specified multiplier
member.param: The TimeSpan struct to multiply
The multiplier
member.returns: A TimeSpan representing the calculated multiplication

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions.ToSpokenString(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Returns a string that represent the most significant portions of the specified TimeSpan
member.param: The TimeSpan to convert to string
member.returns: The string that contains the significant portions of the TimeSpan

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.DateTimeExtensions.TrimMilliseconds(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Rounds toward zero the given date/time's ticks to the nearest millisecond.
member.param: The date/time value to round
member.returns: The rounded date/time

member.name: T:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods
member.summary: Provides various general-purpose useful extension methods

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.TryGet``2(``0,System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Returns the result of func(obj) if obj is not null, or null otherwise. Similiar to the Elvis Operator available in C# 6.
member.typeparam: The type of the result of func
member.param: The object to invoke the function on. Can be null
The function to invoke on in case it's not null
member.returns: The result of func(obj) if obj is ot null, or null otherwise
member.remarks: This method is extremely useful when it is used when it is used few times in a row, to get a specific value from a complex data structure that any of its part may be null. One common such scenario is when using objects that are generated through XSD.exe or a similiar tool.
member.example: var order = GetOrder(); // may return null var street = order.(x => x.Customer).TryGet(x => x.Address).TryGet(x => x.Address);

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.SafeEquals``1(``0,``0)
member.summary: Compares 2 objects, even if they're null.
member.param: First object to compare
2nd object to compare
member.returns: true if the values of and are the same, even if it's null. Otherwise false

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.IsEmpty``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Determines whether the specified sequence is empty
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the sequence
member.param: The sequence
member.returns: true if the sequence is empty, otherwise false

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.SubArray``1(``0[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies a portion of the array into a new array, given the start index and length
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the array
member.param: The original array
The index of the first element to copy
The number of elements to copy
member.returns: A new array containing only the specified elements

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.SubArray``1(``0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies a portion of the array into a new array, starting at the specified index up to the end of the array
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the array
member.param: The original array
The index of the first element to copy
member.returns: A new array containing the last portion, starting at the specified index

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.GetCurrentMainWindowTitle(System.Diagnostics.Process)
member.summary: Returns the title of the main window of the specified process as it is now
member.param: The process to look for its main window title
member.returns: The title of the main window
member.remarks: Unlike , this method always return the up-to-date title of the main window, even if it has changed after the has been started

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.Content``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns the single element contained in the specified sequence
member.typeparam: The type of the element inside the sequence
member.param: The sequence containing the single element
member.returns: The element contained in the sequence
member.exception: The sequence is empty or it contains more than one element
member.remarks:
This method is similiar to but provide more detailed message if it fails.
Because it's not possible to "override" a static method, and in order to prevent the inadvertent use of the original method, this class hides the original method by declaring another method with the same name, and an [Obsolete] attribute.

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.Find``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,``1}},``1)
member.summary: Returns the single element in the specified sequence whose specified property has the specified value
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the sequence
member.param: The sequence containing the element to look for
A lambda expression that returns the property to compare with
The value of the property that the element should have
member.returns: The element that its property matches the expected value
member.exception: The sequence contains no matching element or it contains more than one matching element
member.remarks: This method is similiar to but provide more detailed message if it fails.

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.Find``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Returns the single element in the specified sequence that matches the specified criteria
member.typeparam: The type of the element in the sequence
member.param: The sequence containing the element to look for
A lambda expression of a condition that the matching element should pass
member.returns: The element that matches the specified condition
member.exception: The sequence contains no matching element or it contains more than one matching element
member.remarks:
This method is similiar to but provide more detailed message if it fails.
Because it's not possible to "override" a static method, and in order to prevent the inadvertent use of the original method, this class hides the original method by declaring another method with the same name, and an [Obsolete] attribute.

member.summary: Appends one dictionary to another

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.GetDescription``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns the description of an enum member, according to its DescriptionAttribute if present
member.param: The value of the enum
member.returns: The description of the enum member according to the DescriptionAttribute if present, or the member's name
member.exception: TEnum is not an enum type
member.example:
enum Countries { [Description("United States")] US, [Description("United Kingdom")] UK, Israel }
Console.WriteLine(Countries.US.GetDescription()); // United States Console.WriteLine(Countries.UK.GetDescription()); // United Kingdom COnsole.WriteLine(Countries.Israel.GetDescription()); // Israel

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ExtensionMethods.ParseAs``1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the enum value whose name or description corresponds to the specified string
member.param: The string to parse
member.returns: The enum's value whose name or description corresponds to the specified string
member.exception: The specified string does not match any of the names or descriptions of the enum members
member.remarks: If members of the enum has a applied to them, then the specified value can match either the name of the member or the value of the .
member.example:
enum Countries { [Description("United States")] US, [Description("United Kingdom")] UK, Israel }
Countries countries; countries = "United State".ParseAs<Countries>(); // countries == Countries.US countries = "United Kingdom".ParseAs<Countries>(); // countries == Countries.UK countries = "UK".ParseAs<Countries>(); // countries == Countries.UK countries = "Israel".ParseAs<Countries>(); // countries == Countries.Israel (note that there's no Description attribute on Israel)

The maximum length to keep
member.returns: If is greater than the length of this method returns , otherwise, it returns the first characters of

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ImageExtensions.ToImage(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates an image from a byte array
member.param: A byte array that comprise the image, in every format that may be stored in a valid image file
member.returns: The corresponding image

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ImageExtensions.FitToSize(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Resizes the given image to fit in the specified size
member.param: The image to resize
The target size of the image
member.returns: A new object that contains the resized image
member.remarks: The method can either shrink or grow the original image, but always keeps the original ratio. If the ratio of the original image is not the same as of the target size, then the image is centered and the borders (either top & bottom or left & right) are left empty (black)

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ImageExtensions.GetBitmapBytes(System.Drawing.Image)
member.summary: Returns the bytes of a bitmap as they would be saved to a .bmp file
member.param: The image to serialize
member.returns: A byte array containing the serialized image as a bitmap

member.name: T:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Logger
member.summary: Writes log entries, using indentations to enhance its readability

member.summary: Provides default implementations for WriteLine that can be used with

member.name: F:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Logger.DefaultImplementations.Console
member.summary: Provides the implementation that writes the line to the Console's output

member.name: F:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Logger.DefaultImplementations.Trace
member.summary: Provides the implementation that writes the line to the debugger's trace output

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Logger.Initialize(System.Action{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes the logger to use the specified implementation for writing a line to the log
member.param: A delegate that writes a line to the log. You can use any of the members of or provide your own
member.remarks: You should only call this method once in your assembly initialization code (i.e. [AssemblyInitialize] method if you're using MSTest)

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Logger.WriteLine(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a line to the log, in the current indentation level, and the current time
member.param: The format of the line
The format arguments to embbed in the line

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Logger.WriteLine(System.Object)
member.summary: Writes the string representation (.ToString()) of the object to the log
member.param: The object whose string representation should be written to the log

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Logger.IncreaseIndent
member.summary: Increases the indentation for the upcoming writes

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Logger.DecreaseIndent
member.summary: Decreases the indentation for the upcoming writes

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Logger.StartSection(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes the specified formatted line to the log, and increases the indentation for the upcoming writes, until the returned object is disposed
member.param: The format of the line
The format arguments to embbed in the line
member.returns: An IDisposable object, which when disposed returns the indentation back to what it was before was called
member.remarks: This method is mainly useful inside a using statement, as in the following example:

example.code: This is an ordinary line This is the section header This is an indented line This is a section header for a deeper section This line is indented even deeper This is still part of the outer section This is an ordinary line after the section has completed

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.ReflectionExtensions.GetDefaultValue(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the default value of the specified type
member.param: The type to get its default value
member.returns: The default value of the specified type
member.remarks: This method is similiar to the expression: default(T) that is useful mainly in Generic methods. However, with default(T) the type must be known at compile time (or be a generic type), while with this ' method, the type can be specified at run-time.

member.name: T:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Wait
member.summary: Provide convinient methods for waiting for a condition to come true.

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Wait.Until(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{System.Boolean}},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits until the specified condition becomes true
member.param: A lamba expression containing the condition
The maximum time to wait for the condition
member.exception: The condition didn't become true for the specified timeout

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Wait.While(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{System.Boolean}},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits until the specified condition becomes false
member.param: A lambda expression containing the condition
The maximum time to wait for the condition to become false
member.exception: The condition didn't become false for the specified timeout

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Wait.While(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Waits until the specified condition becomes false
member.param: The condition to wait for to become false
The maximum time to wait for the condition to become false
The message to use in the exception in case of a timeout
Additional format arguments to embedd in
member.exception: Any of the arguments is null
timeoutMessage is invalid.-or- The index of a format item is less than zero, or greater than or equal to the length of the args array.
The condition didn't become false for the specified timeout. The message of the exception is specified by the argument

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Wait.Until(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Waits until the specified condition becomes true. In case of a timeout, the specified message is used in the exception
member.param: The condition to wait for to become true
The maximum time to wait for the condition to become true
The message to use in the exception in case of a timeout
Additional format arguments to embedd in
member.exception: Any of the arguments is null
timeoutMessage is invalid.-or- The index of a format item is less than zero, or greater than or equal to the length of the args array.
The condition didn't become true for the specified timeout. The message of the exception is specified by the argument

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Wait.Until``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0}},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Boolean}},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Evaluates the specified expression until it meets the specified condition, and return the value of this expression
member.param: The expression to evaulate
The condition to wait for to become true
The maximum time to wait for the condition to become true
member.typeparam: The type that the expression resolves to
member.returns: The value of the expression when it meets the condition
member.exception: The condition didn't become true for the specified timeout
member.remarks: When this method throws , it uses the expressions as part of the exception's message

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Wait.Until``1(System.Func{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean},System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes the specified delegate until its return value meets the specified condition, and returns that value
member.param: The delegate to invoke
The condition to wait for to become true
The maximum time to wait for the condition to become true
The message to use in the exception in case of a timeout
Additional format arguments to embedd in
member.typeparam: The type that the delegate returns
member.returns: The return value of the delegate when it meets the condition
member.exception: The condition didn't become true for the specified timeout
timeoutMessage is invalid.-or- The index of a format item is less than zero, or greater than or equal to the length of the args array.
member.example: // Waits until the quote reaches 10 and returns it Quote quote = Wait.Until(() => GetQuote(), qt => qt.Value > 10, 5.Minutes(), "Quote didn't reach {0}", 10);
member.remarks: When this method throws it uses the and its corresponding as the message of the exception

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Wait.IfNot(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits until the specified condition is met or until the specified period has passed, whichever comes first. This method doesn't throw TimeoutException.
member.param: The condition to evaluate
The period to wait for the condition
member.returns: Whether the condition has been met
member.remarks: You should use it for non critical and possibly very short conditions that the polling may miss. After calling this method you should verify (or wait) for a different condition that indicates that the operation has actually completed or not.

member.name: M:TestAutomationEssentials.Common.Wait.If(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits while the specified condition is met or until the specified period has passed. This method doesn't throw TimeoutException.
member.param: The condition to evaluate
The period to wait for the condition
member.returns: Whether the condition has been met
member.remarks: You should use it for non critical and possibly very short conditions that the polling may miss. After calling this method you should verify (or wait) for a different condition that indicates that the operation has actually completed or not.
